Name: Conforming the New York city energy conservation code to recent amendments to the 2016 New York state energy code.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the New York city energy conservation code to recent amendments to the 2016 New York state energy code.

Attachments.Name: September 14, 2016 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
September 28, 2016 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - September 28, 2016

Summary: The State Energy Law permits municipalities to promulgate local energy conservation construction codes, provided that those codes are at least as stringent as the State Energy Code. The State recently amended certain provisions of the State Energy Code. This bill would make various technical corrections to the New York City Energy Conservation Code as well as updating such code to match the new State standards.
Text:

      Section 1.  Section 28-1001.1.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 91 for the year 2016, is amended to read as follows:
�28-1001.1.1 Definition.  As used in this chapter, the term "New York State Energy Code" means the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the "New York State Energy Code"), constituting part 1240 of title 19 of the New York codes, rules and regulations (19 NYCRR Part 1240), and the publications incorporated by reference in such part, promulgated on [April 6, 2016] September 21,  2016, by the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council pursuant to Article 11 of the New York State Energy Law.

      � 3.  Section 28-1001.2.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law 91 for the year 2016, is amended by adding  New York city amendments to Section C406.7.1 of the New York State energy code to read as follows: 
C406.7.1 Load Fraction.

Section C406.7.1 - Revise the first sentence of Section C406.7.1 to read as follows:

The building service water-heating system shall have one or more of the following that are sized to provide not less than 60 percent of hot water requirements, or sized to provide 100 percent of hot water requirements if the building shall otherwise comply with Section C403.4.5.


      � 4.  Section 28-1001.2.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law 91 for the year 2016, is amended by adding New York city amendments to Section 4.2.1.1 of the New York State energy code  to read as follows:
Section 4 - ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT

4.2.1.1 New Buildings.  

Section 4.2.1.1 - Delete Section 4.2.1.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 4.2.1.1 to read as follows:

New buildings shall comply with either the provisions of

a. Section 5, "Building Envelope"; Section 6, "Heating, Ventilating, and Air Conditioning"; Section 7, "Service Water Heating"; Section 8, "Power"; Section 9, "Lighting"; and Section 10, "Other Equipment"; or

b. Section 11, "Energy Cost Budget Method"; or                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        c.  Appendix G, "Performance Rating Method."

When using Appendix G, the Performance Cost Index (PCI) shall be less than or equal to the Performance Cost Index Target (PCIt) when calculated in accordance with the following:

PCIt  = (BBUEC + (BPF x BBREC))/BBP        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Where:

PCI      =    Performance     Cost     Index     calculated    in accordance with Section G1.2.

BBUEC = Baseline  Building  Unregulated  Energy  Cost. The portion of the annual energy cost of a baseline building design that is due to unregulated energy use.

BBREC =    Baseline Building Regulated Energy Cost. The portion of the annual energy cost of a baseline building design that is due to regulated energy use.

BPF = Building Performance Factor from Table 4.2.1.1. For building area types not listed in Table 4.2.1.1 use "All others." Where a building has multiple building area types, the required BPF shall be equal to the area-weighted average of the building area types.

BBP =   baseline building performance.

Regulated energy cost shall be calculated by multiplying the total energy cost by the ratio of regulated energy use to total energy use for each fuel type. Unregulated energy cost shall be calculated by subtracting regulated energy cost from total energy cost.

      � 6.   The New York city amendments to Section R202 of the New York state energy code, as added by local law 91 for the year 2016, are amended to read as follows: 
SECTION R202
GENERAL DEFINITIONS
 
Delete the definitions of "2016 Uniform Code Supplement," "2015 International Building Code (As Amended)," "2015 International Fire Code (As Amended)," "2015 International Fuel Gas Code (As Amended)," "2015 International Mechanical Code (As Amended)," "2015 International Plumbing Code (As Amended)," "2015 International Property Maintenance Code (As Amended)," and "2015 International Residential Code (As Amended)."
 
Revise the definition of "Approved" after the definition of "Alteration," to read as follows:
       
   APPROVED. See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.
    
Add a new definition of "Approved agency" after the definition of "Approved," to read as follows:
    
   APPROVED AGENCY.  See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.
 
Delete the definitions of "ASHRAE 90.1-2013" and "ASHRAE 90.1-2013 (As amended)" after the definition of "Area weighted average."
 
Add a new definition of "Authority having jurisdiction" after the definition of "Area weighted average" to read as follows:
 
AUTHORITY HAVING JURISDICTION. The commissioner or the commissioner's designee.
    
Revise the definition of "Building site" after the definition of "Building," to read as follows:
   
BUILDING SITE. A contiguous area of land that is under the ownership or control of one entity.

Revise the definition of "Building thermal envelope" after the definition of "Building [site] system," to read as follows:

BUILDING THERMAL ENVELOPE. The exterior walls (above and below grade), floor, roof, and any other building elements that enclose conditioned space or provide a boundary between conditioned space and exempt or unconditioned space.

Revise the term "Code official" after the definition of "Climate Zone," to read as follows:
 
   CODE OFFICIAL. The commissioner or the commissioner's designee. 
    
Delete the definition of "Energy code", after the definition of "Energy Analysis."
 
Add a new definition of "Grade plane" after the definition of "General lighting," to read as follows:
    
GRADE PLANE. A reference plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at exterior walls. Where the finished ground level slopes away from the exterior walls, the reference plane shall be established by the lowest points within the area between the building and the lot line or, where the lot line is more than 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building, between the building and a point 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building.
 
Add a new definition of "Lead energy professional" after the definition of "Labeled," to read as follows:
 
LEAD ENERGY PROFESSIONAL. The registered design professional who signs and seals the energy analysis for an entire project. Such individual may be the same registered design professional who signs and seals the design drawings for the same project.
 
Add new definitions of "Professional certification" and "Project" after the definition of "Manual," to read as follows:
 
   PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION. See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code. 
 
PROJECT.  A design and construction undertaking comprised of work related to one or more buildings and the site improvements. A project is represented by one or more plan/work applications, including construction documents compiled in accordance with Section 107 of the New York City Building Code, that relate either to the construction of a new building or buildings or to the demolition or alteration of an existing building or buildings. Applications for a project may have different registered design professionals and different job numbers, and may result in the issuance of one or more permits.
 
Delete the definition of "Uniform Code."

\ulnone\par
\ul 4.2.1.1 New Buildings.\b0   \par
\par
Section 4.2.1.1 - Delete Section 4.2.1.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 4.2.1.1 to read as follows:\par
\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\ul New buildings shall comply with either the provisions of\ulnone\par
\par
\ul a. Section 5, \ldblquote Building Envelope\rdblquote ; Section 6, \ldblquote Heating, Ventilating, and Air Conditioning\rdblquote ; Section 7, \ldblquote Service Water Heating\rdblquote ; Section 8, \ldblquote Power\rdblquote ; Section 9, \ldblquote Lighting\rdblquote ; and Section 10, \ldblquote Other Equipment\rdblquote ; or\ulnone\par
\par
\ul b. Section 11, \ldblquote Energy Cost Budget Method\rdblquote ; or                                                                                                                                                                                                                             \par
\ulnone                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         \ul c.  Appendix G, \ldblquote Performance Rating Method.\rdblquote\par
\par
When using Appendix G, the Performance Cost Index (PCI) shall be less than or equal to the Performance Cost Index Target (PCIt) when calculated in accordance with the following:\par
\par
PCI\sub t\nosupersub   = (BBUEC + (BPF x BBREC))/BBP        \par
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Where:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj PCI      =    Performance     Cost     Index     calculated    in accordance with Section G1.2.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li720\qj BBUEC = Baseline  Building  Unregulated  Energy  Cost. The portion of the annual energy cost of a baseline building design that is due to unregulated energy use.\par
\par
BBREC =    Baseline Building Regulated Energy Cost. The portion of the annual energy cost of a baseline building design that is due to regulated energy use.\par
\par
BPF = Building Performance Factor from Table 4.2.1.1. For building area types not listed in Table 4.2.1.1 use \ldblquote All others.\rdblquote  Where a building has multiple building area types, the required BPF shall be equal to the area-weighted average of the building area types.\par
\par
BBP =   baseline building performance.\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj Regulated energy cost shall be calculated by multiplying the total energy cost by the ratio of regulated energy use to total energy use for each fuel type. Unregulated energy cost shall be calculated by subtracting regulated energy cost from total energy cost.\ulnone    \par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
\par

\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0\'a7 6.   The New York city amendments to Section R202 of the New York state energy code, as added by local law 91 for the year 2016, are amended to read as follows: \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qc\cf1\b SECTION R202\b0\par
\b GENERAL DEFINITIONS\b0\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj Delete the definitions of \ldblquote 2016 Uniform Code Supplement,\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Building Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Fire Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Fuel Gas Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Mechanical Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Plumbing Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  \ldblquote 2015 International Property Maintenance Code (As Amended),\rdblquote  and \ldblquote 2015 International Residential Code (As Amended).\rdblquote\par
 \par
Revise the definition of \ldblquote Approved\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Alteration,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi720\qj  \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\b APPROVED.\b0  See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj Add a new definition of \ldblquote Approved agency\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Approved,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj  \par
\b APPROVED AGENCY.\b0   See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj  \par
Delete the definitions of \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2013\rdblquote  and \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2013 (As amended)\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Area weighted average.\rdblquote\par
 \par
Add a new definition of \ldblquote Authority having jurisdiction\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Area weighted average\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\b AUTHORITY HAVING JURISDICTION.\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj  \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\ul Revise the definition of \ldblquote Building site\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Building,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\ulnone\b\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\cf0\ul BUILDING SITE.\b0  A contiguous area of land that is under the ownership or control of one entity.\par
\pard\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\ulnone\par
\cf1 Revise the definition of \ldblquote Building thermal envelope\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Building [site] \ul system\ulnone ,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\cf0\par
\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\cf1\b BUILDING THERMAL ENVELOPE.\b0  The exterior walls (above and below grade), floor, roof, and any other building elements that enclose conditioned space or provide a boundary between conditioned space and exempt or unconditioned space.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj\par
Revise the term \ldblquote Code official\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Climate Zone,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\b CODE OFFICIAL.\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee. \par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj Delete the definition of \ldblquote Energy code\rdblquote , after the definition of \ldblquote Energy Analysis.\rdblquote\par
 \par
Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Grade plane\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote General lighting,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj  \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\qj\b GRADE PLANE\b0 . A reference plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at exterior walls. Where the finished ground level slopes away from the exterior walls, the reference plane shall be established by the lowest points within the area between the building and the lot line or, where the lot line is more than 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building, between the building and a point 6 feet (1829 mm) from the building.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0  \par
Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote Lead energy professional\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote Labeled,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\b LEAD ENERGY PROFESSIONAL. \b0 The registered design professional who signs and seals the energy analysis for an entire project. Such individual may be the same registered design professional who signs and seals the design drawings for the same project.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0  \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj Add new definitions of \ldblquote Professional certification\rdblquote  and \ldblquote Project\rdblquote  after the definition of "Manual," to read as follows:\par
 \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\fi360\qj\b PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION. \b0 See Section 28-101.5 of the Administrative Code.\cf2  \cf1\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\qj  \par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0\li360\b PROJECT.\b0   A design and construction undertaking comprised of work related to one or more buildings and the site improvements. A project is represented by one or more plan/work applications, including construction documents compiled in accordance with Section 107 of the New York City Building Code, that relate either to the construction of a new building or buildings or to the demolition or alteration of an existing building or buildings. Applications for a project may have different registered design professionals and different job numbers, and may result in the issuance of one or more permits.\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\hyphpar0  \par
Delete the definition of \ldblquote Uniform Code.\rdblquote\par
\par
\par
